Nooz

Class newspaperStory

  • java.lang.Object
    • Nooz.newspaperStory

  • public class newspaperStory
extends java.lang.Object
    The newspaperStory class allows for the creation of and interaction with objects containing information about each individual news story
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Alex Kloppenburg

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String date
      A string containing the date the story was published.
      private java.lang.String firstNewsmaker
      A String containing the first person the story is about.
      private int numWords
      An integer that represents the number of words in the story.
      private java.lang.String secondNewsmaker
      A String containing the second person the story is about.
      private java.lang.String sourceName
      A String containing the name of the newspaper that published the story.
      private java.lang.String topicName
      A String containing the topic of the story.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      newspaperStory(java.lang.String date, int sourceCode, int numWords, int topicCode, java.lang.String firstNewsmaker, java.lang.String secondNewsmaker)
      Takes in values for each parameter, creates a new NewspaperStory object, turns the codes for the source and topic from ints into Strings, and assigns values to the appropriate fields.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDate()
      Returns the date of the current newspaperStory object in MM/DD/YYYY format.
      java.lang.String getFirstNewsmaker()
      Returns the name of the first person that the story is about, or "none" if there is no first person.
      int getNumWords()
      Returns an integer representing the number of words in the story.
      java.lang.String getSecondNewsmaker()
      Returns the name of the second person that the story is about, or "none" if there is no second person.
      java.lang.String getSourceCode()
      Returns the name of the newspaper that published the story as a String.
      protected java.lang.String getSourceFromCode(int sourceCodeNum)
      Helper function that takes in the integer representing the newspaper that published the story and returns the newspaper's name as a String.
      java.lang.String getTopic()
      Returns the story's topic as a String.
      protected java.lang.String getTopicFromCode(int topicCodeNum)
      Helper function that takes in the integer representing the topic of the story and returns the topic as a String.
      java.lang.String toString() 

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • newspaperStory

        public newspaperStory(java.lang.String date,
                      int sourceCode,
                      int numWords,
                      int topicCode,
                      java.lang.String firstNewsmaker,
                      java.lang.String secondNewsmaker)
        Takes in values for each parameter, creates a new NewspaperStory object, turns the codes for the source and topic from ints into Strings, and assigns values to the appropriate fields.
        Parameters:
        date - A string containing the date the story was published.
        sourceCode - An integer corresponding to the newspaper that published the story.
        numWords - An integer that represents the number of words in the story.
        topicCode - An integer corresponding to the topic of the story.
        firstNewsmaker - A String containing the first person the story is about.
        secondNewsmaker - A String containing the second person the story is about.
